content: stability make sure the placement of the mandibles match on both sides of the face ❖ arms sew the arms in the same way as the mandibles about 9 stitches apart under the belly on opposite sides with the picot on each end facing forward photos right -> 1 2 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn all rights reserved all documents and pictures in said documents are property of megan nelson copyright laws fins using the long yarn from each piece sew the small tail fins to the tail positioning them on either side as pictured on page 11 the thick end of the tail fins sewn to the reaper s tail note sometimes the small tail fins curl slightly if so then i suggest perhaps blocking them getting them wet and letting them dry in a flat position before sewing them onto the reaper ❖ sew the dorsal fins along the back of the reaper down either side of the back not sewing them flat to the reaper but only sewing along one edge of the dorsal fins so that they stick out like fins i pinned them in place before sewing so that they were mostly symmetrical photos left <- ❖ sew the belly fins underneath the tail again-not sewing them flatly to the reaper s belly but only sewing along the edge of each belly fin to attach them to the reaper i sewed them underneath the tail not too close to the small tail fins or the dorsal fins but somewhere in the middle on the underside of the reaper photo example of placement on page 11 ❖ the photos right -> are an example of how i sewed the fins so that the yarn from attaching them isn t visible when finished i inserted the needle and brought it out where i wanted to sew down the fin then i threaded the needle through a stitch of the fin and then i inserted the needle back down into the same space that i had brought the needle up from repeating this basic method all along the fins while pulling the yarn tight each time will mostly hide the yarn this is optional though 1 3 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn all rights reserved all
